reviews.name: Naresh Bodhas
reviews.feedback: A good HTML course should be beginner-friendly, hands-on, and cover foundational topics like tags, forms, and semantic HTML. Real-world projects and integration with CSS/JavaScript make it more practical. Courses with interactive elements and advanced topics like accessibility are highly recommended.
reviews.suggestions: Include more real-world projects and exercises for better practice.

reviews.name: John Doe
reviews.feedback: This HTML course was straightforward and helped me understand the structure of web pages. It covers all the necessary tags and elements. More focus on responsive design would be beneficial.
reviews.suggestions: Focus more on mobile-first design techniques.

reviews.name: Jane Smith
reviews.feedback: The course provided a good introduction to CSS. The examples helped me understand layout, but more advanced topics like animations and transitions should be covered.
reviews.suggestions: Add more detailed exercises on animations and transitions.

reviews.name: Robert Johnson
reviews.feedback: This course did an excellent job of teaching core JavaScript concepts. The hands-on exercises were particularly helpful in reinforcing what I learned.
reviews.suggestions: Consider adding sections on advanced ES6+ features like async/await.

reviews.name: Emily Taylor
reviews.feedback: I really enjoyed the React course! It helped me understand component-based architecture and state management. I feel confident building React apps now.
reviews.suggestions: Could have more real-world use cases and integration with external APIs.

reviews.name: Michael Brown
reviews.feedback: The jQuery course covered the basics effectively but felt outdated. Many modern JavaScript libraries provide better solutions.
reviews.suggestions: Update the content with more focus on modern JavaScript alternatives.

reviews.name: Sophia Davis
reviews.feedback: This PHP course is a great starting point for beginners, covering essential concepts such as variables, loops, and functions. More on database interaction with MySQL would help.
reviews.suggestions: Include more practical examples with MySQL integration.

reviews.name: David Lee
reviews.feedback: Python is well-explained, and the examples were hands-on. I now understand how to build basic applications, but the course could be more challenging.
reviews.suggestions: Add intermediate-level projects for better learning.

reviews.name: Olivia Harris
reviews.feedback: The Java course was detailed, with plenty of hands-on coding examples. However, the pace was a bit slow for experienced learners.
reviews.suggestions: Speed up the pace for advanced learners.
